actions-list.header: Board of Visitors to the United States Naval Academy
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to 10 U.S.C. 8468(a), the Democratic Leader appointed the following member of the House to the Board of Visitors to the United States Naval Academy: Ms. Elfreth.

actions-list.header: Board of Visitors to the United States Military Academy
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to 10 U.S.C. 4355(a), the Democratic Leader appointed the following member of the House to the Board of Visitors to the United States Military Academy: Mr. Ryan.

actions-list.header: Board of Visitors to the United States Air Force Academy
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to 10 U.S.C. 9455(a), the Democratic Leader appointed the following member of the House to the Board of Visitors to the United States Air Force Academy: Mr. Davis of North Carolina.

actions-list.header: Commission on Reform and Modernization of the Department of State
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to section 9803(d)(1)(C) and (E) of the James M. Inhofe National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2023 (Public Law 117-263), the Democratic Leader appointed the following member of the House to the Commission on Reform and Modernization of the Department of State: Mr. Quigley.
Pursuant to Section 4(c) of House Resolution 5, 119th Congress, the Democratic Leader appointed the following member of the House to the Tom Lantos Human Rights Commission: Mr. McGovern.

Pursuant to Section 4(b) of House Resolution 5, 119th Congress, the Democratic Leader appointed the following members of the House to the House Democracy Partnership: Ms. Titus, Ms. Moore of Wisconsin, Mr. Lieu, Mrs. Torres of California, Ms. Kelly of Illinois, Ms. Sewell, Ms. DeGette, Ms. Omar and Mrs. Ramirez.

Pursuant to Section 4 of the United States Semiquincentennial Commission Act of 2016 (Public Law 114-196), the Democratic Leader appointed the following members of the House to serve as Commissioners to the United States Semiquincentennial Commission: Mrs. Watson Coleman and Mr. Evans of Pennsylvania.
Pursuant to 22 U.S.C. 2903, and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed the following member of the House to the Japan-United States Friendship Commission: Mr. Takano.

Pursuant to section 2 of the Migratory Bird Conservation Act (16 U.S.C. 715a), and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed the following member of the House to the Migratory Bird Conservation Commission: Mr. Thompson of California.

actions-list.header: Congressional-Executive Commission on the People's Republic of China
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to 22 U.S.C. 6913, and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed the following member of the House to the Congressional-Executive Commission on the People's Republic of China: Mr. McGovern.

actions-list.header: Board of Visitors to the United States Coast Guard Academy
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to 14 U.S.C. 1903(b), and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed the following member of the House to the Board of Visitors to the United States Coast Guard Academy: Mr. Courtney.

actions-list.header: United States Group of the NATO Parliamentary Assembly
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to 22 U.S.C. 1928a, and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed the following member of the House to the United States Group of the NATO Parliamentary Assembly: Mr. Bergman.
The Chair led the House in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
Pursuant to clause 13 of Rule I, the Journal of the last day's proceedings was approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Rev. John Kellogg, Christ Church, Washington Parish, Washington D.C.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Elise M. Stefanik to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
